content.description:
In the center of Upper Tier there is a gully.  To the right of this gully, there is a prominent crack.  Follow this crack through a small overhang and onto the slab above. 

  --- Invalid image id: 108140456 ---
content.protection: Standard rack trad gear to top.  Can build trad anchor for belay or top rope using long webbing to trees far back from the edge of cliff.

content.description:
Climb the left side of the corner of the 4th class gully.  

  --- Invalid image id: 108140456 ---

A very easy climb with great hand holds and better feet. Perfect for a beginner trying to get used to the height. It is more of a walk up and no real power or strength is needed. I had a great time learning here.
content.protection: I would recommend a top rope setup. There are a few trees and a boulder at the top to anchor from. There are a few fixed bolts that could never break, ever - but they are a bit off sides or too far back. About 50ft of some static nylon and some slings will make a great setup.
content.location:
The route is on the upper tier, to the right of a big slabby section. There is a small crack to the right of Star Fire (very fun), and further to the right is a grade 4 gully. The route has a reddish/orange hue to it, with some nice white rocks in the crack. You can't miss it. You can walk down either side from the top or rappel down.

 --- Invalid image id: 108140456 ---

content.description: This climb is located at the far right side of the upper tier. Topo: --- Invalid image id: 108140456 ---
It's a really simple route with not much to it, it's only good as an introductory route.
content.protection: Eyebolt anchor and a few trees make for an easy toprope setup.
content.location:
"The start is marked by a short "corner" that gains the base of the left side of the crag. Climb up the face just right of the "corner" to the top. A huge eyebolt marks the top." Rock climbing Connecticut  

  This route is right near a large step about 4 feet high at the bottom left side of the cliff.  

  You can either walk off to either side or repel down.

content.description:
Located to the right of Crystal Dilemma climb straight up the slab. See topo below: 

  --- Invalid image id: 108140456 ---

Several feet right of Toe Crack. Work up the face past a small overlap and straight to the top. Topo below: 

  --- Invalid image id: 108140456 ---

Ascend the face to the right of Lady Bug.

 Per 2015 Falcon Guide: “Climb up the center of the clean slab, following the hairline crack”. Between Lady Bug and the left side of the hairline crack is “Beach Party” (5.5 TR). Between the right side of the hairline crack and Star Fire is “Cleanup Party” (5.4 TR)

4th Class Gully to the top of the cliff.  

  --- Invalid image id: 108140456 ---

The Upper Tier has some nice low angle slabs that are great for beginner climbers.  There are also some cracks and slightly steeper sections that can be led or top roped.  The rock is good quality and clean.
